title.narrative: Agricultural cooperatives and inclusion of rural youth

description.narrative:
The main objective of the proposal is to explore youth’s perspectives and needs for engaging in agricultural cooperatives, gathering best practices and failed attempts on youth inclusion in farmer cooperatives and providing recommendations to increase youth inclusion. This project will include a comparative case study approach of youth engagement in agricultural cooperatives. We have identified three overarching knowledge questions:Main knowledge questions:1. What is the current situation of membership of young women and men in agricultural cooperatives?2. What are opportunities and barriers for young women and men to become active members? and3. How are these barriers currently being overcome? How are opportunities being exploited?
Set-up field work  The comparative case study approach will focus on three countries: Rwanda, Tanzania and Uganda. Per country selection of two agricultural cooperatives, preferably in the horticultural and/or dairy sector. Size of the cooperative: minimum 500 members Age category of youth: 18-30 Per cooperative the data collection methods will be:- one focus group discussion (FGD) with young female members- one FGD with young male members- one FGD group discussion with non-members (youth)- semi structured interviews with one board member and one management member The group size for the focus group discussions is preferably between 10-15 participants Five days of field work in total per countryTasks Agriterra staff member in RwandaThe Agriterra staff member is responsible for: Overall communication with cooperatives in relation to goal of research/field work and making necessary arrangements for field work In collaboration with cooperative, invite participants for FGDs and interviews Taking notes during FGD’s and interview and writing up of notes according to prepared formats (by KIT-CDI-YPARD) – in English If applicable, communication with local authorities on scope and goals project/field Assistance in collecting additional information and documents of cooperatives Local facilitation and translation of FGD’s and interviews Arranging venue/location for conducting field work Organize refreshments for FGD participants Arranging transportation and accommodation for CDI researcher and joining to field sitesPlanningFieldwork to be conducted in the week of 9-13 October 2017 (5 days)
